title: Upgrade to GitHub-native Dependabot

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
_Dependabot Preview will be shut down on August 3rd, 2021. In order to keep getting Dependabot updates, please merge this PR and migrate to GitHub-native Dependabot before then._

Dependabot has been fully integrated into GitHub, so you no longer have to install and manage a separate app. This pull request migrates your configuration from Dependabot.com to a config file, using the [new syntax][new_syntax]. When merged, we'll swap out `dependabot-preview` (me) for a new `dependabot` app, and you'll be all set!

With this change, you'll now use the [Dependabot page in GitHub][dependabot_page], rather than the [Dependabot dashboard][dashboard], to monitor your version updates, and you'll configure Dependabot through the new config file rather than a UI.







If you've got any questions or feedback for us, please let us know by creating an issue in the [dependabot/dependabot-core][issues] repository.

[Learn more about migrating to GitHub-native Dependabot][learn]

Please note that regular `@dependabot` commands do not work on this pull request.

[dashboard]: https://app.dependabot.com/
[dependabot_page]: https://github.com/rust-vmm/linux-loader/network/updates
[issues]: https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/issues/new?assignees=%40dependabot%2Fpreview-migration-reviewers&labels=E%3A+preview-migration&template=migration-issue.md
[learn]: http://docs.github.com/code-security/supply-chain-security/upgrading-from-dependabotcom-to-github-native-dependabot
[new_syntax]: https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates
[org_secrets_url]: https://github.com/organizations/rust-vmm/settings/secrets/dependabot
[repo_secrets_url]: https://github.com/rust-vmm/linux-loader/settings/secrets/dependabot

title: Added reproducible steps for generating test images
body:
The images we previously used in test were not easy to recreate, and their source (for most of them) was unknown.
To make sure we do not have any licensing problems, and also to make it easy to create new images, all of them were regenerated  from scratch. The documentation now includes reproduction steps for every image.

As a summary, we now have 3 types of images:
- generated by fuzzers (these are named with `fuzz_` so that are easy to identify)
- generated with ELFIO
- generated from kernel sources

This PR also includes some other tiny cleanup:
- fixed clippy errors
- removed outdated section from the testing document

title: src/loader: use Cmdline instead CStr in load_cmdline()
body: Fixes #62

title: elf: `align_up` usage susceptible to data loss
body:
In response to #66.

* While using `aling_up` we're converting the function result
to other data types. The conversions were double checked and
comments were added to clarify why they are safe.

title: release v0.3.0
body: This release comes with fixes for potential security vulnerabilities.

title: Add checks for arithmetic operations
body:
This PR adds checks for arithmetic operations to make sure that the VM exits cleanly.
More details about each fix in the corresponding commit messages.

title: Simple Fixes examples in src/lib.rs and clippy warnings.
body: #58 and related to #36

title: remove build.rs
body:
Download the needed resources before running the tests.
Do not use include_bytes! macro because it makes cargo check fail when the bzimage path does not work.

Build.rs is not a feasible solution because the build of linux-loader will fail on machines without network connectivity.

Reported-by: @rbradford

title: Run unit tests on local dev machines
body: This PR removes the buildkite hooks and makes it possible to run the unit tests on local dev machines as well by downloading the required resources for running the test as part of a rust build script.

title: Specify serial console & virtio MMIO devices to the kernel command line
body: This PR extends the `Cmdline` with the possibility of specifying serial console and virtio MMIO device configurations, which are transparently stringified and appended to the command line.

title: Update test_elf.bin with a saner one
body:
#41 

`readelf -l test_elf.bin` will give the following output:

```
Elf file type is EXEC (Executable file)
Entry point 0x100000
There are 2 program headers, starting at offset 64

Program Headers:
  Type           Offset             VirtAddr           PhysAddr
                 FileSiz            MemSiz              Flags  Align
  LOAD           0x0000000000001000 0x0000000000100000 0x0000000000100000
                 0x000000000000001f 0x000000000000001f  R E    0x1000
  LOAD           0x0000000000002000 0x0000000000101000 0x0000000000101000
                 0x000000000000000e 0x000000000000000e  RW     0x1000

 Section to Segment mapping:
  Segment Sections...
   00     .text 
   01     .data 
```

Note: the current image and the old one have the same code segment content, the data segments differ just a bit (hence the slight difference between `FileSiz` and `MemSiz`, but they contain pretty much the same `Hello, world!`).

title: Cargo.toml updates necessary for crates.io publishing
Force UTF-8 encoding in custom pipeline and block criterion version
body: This prevents Unicode encoding errors when printing to `stdout` from the benchmark integ test and stabilizes `criterion` output.

title: Add benchmark tests for publicly exposed functions
body:
The first commit is a subset of #43, with an additional commit adding benchmarks for the bzImage loading functionality (and showcasing how to benchmark feature-gated functions).

This PR is part of a larger story of adding performance tests to rust-vmm crates and running them automatically. See https://github.com/rust-vmm/rust-vmm-ci/issues/24.

To automatically run these tests in the `linux-loader` crate, the following PRs need to be merged in this order:
1. This PR
1. https://github.com/rust-vmm/rust-vmm-container/pull/28
1. https://github.com/rust-vmm/rust-vmm-ci/pull/25
1. TODO: PR in `linux-loader` that replicates https://github.com/rust-vmm/linux-loader/pull/43/commits/6ceda5b62c8fefa726eb285a2d8df0cee075b0a3 - custom Buildkite pipeline that uses the new container and runs the new integration test

title: cmdline: implement std::error::Error for Error
body:
All Error enumerations except cmdline::Error have implemented
std::error::Error, so add the missing one.

Signed-off-by: Liu Jiang <gerry@linux.alibaba.com>

Please refer to #35 for more information.

title: Clarify uses of kernel_start parameter
body:
As part of the discussion in #12, we have noticed that the `kernel_start` parameter has different usages in the implementations for `PE`, `Elf`, and `BzImage`. The `Elf` implementation is specially confusing, since `kernel_start` is used to specify an offset to add to the default load address of the kernel. The discussion is ongoing to determine whether this has any real use cases or provides any security benefits.

In the meantime, I propose to rename the parameter to `kernel_offset`, which might be more appropriate to describe its usage by the implementers of `KernelLoader`.

Also, since PVH code expects the kernel to be loaded at its default load address, it cannot be used to boot guests if a non-default load address is requested by using the `kernel_offset` argument. If `kernel_offset` is requested, we simply avoid looking for a PVH entry point.

Resolves #12

title: Coverage fixes for crate features and autogenerated files
body:
#34, #21 

* updated `rust-vmm-ci` submodule
* specified all supported features in `coverage_*.json`
* moved bindgen autogenerated files in a separate `mod` to easily exclude them from coverage

title: Complete code-level documentation and examples
body: Fixes #17
